# Data Transformation

We like to use dplyr for data transformation.

## Filtering

If I want to filter my data, use `filter()`.  Here is an example:

```{r warning=FALSE, message=FALSE, collapse=TRUE, echo=FALSE}
library(tidyverse)

# here is a filter example
mtcars %>%
  filter(mpg > 21)
```

## Select

We can use the `select()` function to select specific variables of interest

```{r, collapse = TRUE, echo=FALSE}
mtcars %>%
  select(mpg, cyl, disp) %>%
  filter(mpg > 21)
```


# Visualization

We like to use `ggplot2` for visualization

```{r, echo=FALSE}
mtcars %>%
  select(mpg, cyl, disp) %>%
  filter(mpg > 21) %>%
  ggplot(aes(disp, mpg)) +
  geom_point()
```
